properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: AIR QUALITY ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR SMITHERS (January 22, 2020 - Smithers) The Ministry of Environment and Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with Northern Health and the Town of Smithers has issued an Air Quality Advisory for Smithers because of high concentrations of fine particulate matter. This advisory is in effect until further notice. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions should postpone strenuous exercise until the advisory is lifted. Staying indoors and in air conditioned spaces helps to reduce fine particulate exposure. Exposure is particularly a concern for pregnant women, infants, the elderly and those who have diabetes, and lung or heart disease. For the duration of this advisory the use of woodstoves is prohibited within the Town of Smithers, unless the woodstove is the only source of heat in a dwelling. Real-time air quality observations and information regarding the health effects of air pollution can be found at: https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2020-01-23T09:35:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2020-01-22T17:36:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1614317195.2020
Area: Bulkley Valley
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued By The Village Of Paynton
properties.Summary:
Description: A precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Village of Paynton. This advisory is for the entire community and for any individual who may access water from the Village of Paynton water system. This advisory is in effect until further notice.
Expires: 2020-01-24T14:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Paynton, 2020-01-22T13:42:00-06:00, 1B30D900-E05C-C24E-47BA-991BD9BB8AA9
Area: Village of Paynton
properties.Author: SK Paynton

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. An intense frontal system is rapidly approaching the south coast this morning. Moderate rainfall will begin over west Vancouver Island late this morning. This evening the rain will intensify significantly before it eases off late Thursday morning. Total rainfall accumulations of 100 mm are expected except up to 120 mm near Zeballos and Tahsis. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-01-23T04:47:53-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-01-22T12:48:53-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2104736031.2020
Area: West Vancouver Island
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. An intense frontal system is rapidly approaching the BC Coast. Ahead of the front, southeasterly winds of 90 km/h gusting to 110 are expected to develop over Haida Gwaii and North Coast - Coastal sections later this afternoon. As the frontal system moves onshore the winds are expected to fall below warning criteria later this evening. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-01-23T06:59:20-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-01-22T20:40:20-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2361048501.2020
Area: Haida Gwaii, North Coast - coastal sections
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills is expected. An extremely cold airmass remains entrenched in the area. With winds of 20 km/h and temperatures near -40, wind chill values of -55 are occurring. Conditions may moderate slightly during the day Thursday, however, wind chill values may remain near the -55 mark until Friday morning when temperatures begin to warm. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-01-23T12:37:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-01-22T20:38:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2285721171.2020
Area: Hall Beach
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm is expected. A weather system has stalled near Edmonton, and is giving heavy snow. 5-8 cm has fallen in a line from Leduc to Barrhead, and another 5 cm is expected by this afternoon. The band of snow will move slowly eastwards this afternoon, giving totals close to 10 cm. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-01-23T00:10:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-01-22T15:12:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3040923836.2020

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills is expected. An extremely cold air mass remains entrenched over the area. Combined with winds of 30 km/h, wind chill values are near the -55 mark at Naujaat. Conditions may slightly improve mid day as temperatures slightly warm, ### Risks are greater for young children, older adults, people with chronic illnesses, people working or exercising outdoors, and those without proper shelter. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills continues. The coldest wind chill values will be near minus 55. Temperatures near minus 40 with moderate winds are creating wind chill values near minus 55 this morning. Winds are expected to weaken slightly, and the warning will likely be ended this afternoon. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Risks are greater for young children, older adults, people with chronic illnesses, people working or exercising outdoors, and those without proper shelter. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. An intense frontal system is rapidly approaching the south coast today. Moderate rain will start near mid day and become heavy at times overnight tonight. East Vancouver Island near Bowser is expected to get 80 to 100 mm of rain before it eases Thursday morning. Howe Sound, the North Shore, and the northeast and central Metro Vancouver regions are expected to receive up to 80 mm of rain from this storm. Heavy rain is expected to ease by mid day Thursday. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-01-23T04:45:20-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-01-22T12:46:20-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2608391192.2020
Area: East Vancouver Island - Nanoose Bay to Fanny Bay, Howe Sound, Metro Vancouver - North Shore including West Vancouver and North Vancouver, Metro Vancouver - central including the City of Vancouver Burnaby and New Westminster, Metro Vancouver - northeast including Coquitlam and Maple Ridge
